result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rebekka J. Ames

records.addlTxt:
9:10 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Rebekka J. Ames appeared by video.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Rebekka J. Ames.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Richards is heard on the status of the case.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on December 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury status hearing on December 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:49 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Rebekka J. Ames appeared by phone.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Rebekka J. Ames.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Richards is heard and informed the court of the filing of their waiver of preliminary hearing. 

Court reviews waiver of preliminary hearing and questionnaire form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. 

Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings. 

Atty Richards is heard and they are prepared to go forward with arraignment today. 
Atty Richards is heard and defendant will enter a plea of not guilty.  Clerk is directed to enter ng plea.
Jury status hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on September 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury status hearing on August 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
The 7/6/22 at 10:00 AM PreLim Hearing has been moved to 7/8/22 at 9:45 AM due to court reporter coverage. JA worked with counsel on scheduling.
Preliminary hearing on July 8, 2022 at 09:45 am.

2:05 PM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Rebekka J. Ames appeared by phone.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Rebekka J. Ames.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Richards - ready for Pre-lim to be scheduled - waives time limits
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 6, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel - Atty Steven G. Richards
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel - Atty Steven G. Richards

1:45 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Rebekka J. Ames appeared by phone.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant is heard on the status of retaining an attorney. 
Court gives defendant phone number to state public defenders office.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:36 AM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Rebekka J. Ames in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Def. provided a copy of the criminal complaint at this time

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 

Court questions def. re: efforts to obtain attorney - response by Def.
Def. provided public defender info and advised to reach out ASAP
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:10 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Rebekka J. Ames appeared by video, in custody in the Crawford County Jail.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond. State requests a $300.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with RJA
 
Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $300.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with RJA

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.
